THRESHOLD.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting. This setting applies both for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH) and high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). Values 0-3 set threshold below 1.7 V and should not be used as brown out detection will be activated before power failure warning on such low voltages.

THRESHOLDVDDH.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting for high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). This setting does not apply for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH).

TASKS_START.description: Starts continuous I2S transfer. Also starts MCK generator when this is enabled.

TASKS_STOP.description: Stops I2S transfer. Also stops MCK generator. Triggering this task will cause the STOPPED event to be generated.

EVENTS_RXPTRUPD.description:
The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

EVENTS_TXPTRUPD.description:
The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

ALIGN.description: Alignment of sample within a frame.

MAXCNT.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers.

TASKS_START.description: Starts continuous I2S transfer. Also starts MCK generator when this is enabled.

TASKS_STOP.description: Stops I2S transfer. Also stops MCK generator. Triggering this task will cause the STOPPED event to be generated.

EVENTS_RXPTRUPD.description:
The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

EVENTS_TXPTRUPD.description:
The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

RXPTRUPD.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event RXPTRUPD

STOPPED.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event STOPPED

TXPTRUPD.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event TXPTRUPD

RXPTRUPD.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event RXPTRUPD

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event STOPPED

TXPTRUPD.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event TXPTRUPD

RXPTRUPD.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event RXPTRUPD

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event STOPPED

TXPTRUPD.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TXPTRUPD

ALIGN.description: Alignment of sample within a frame.

PTR.description: Transmit buffer Data RAM start address. When transmitting, words containing samples will be fetched from this address. This address is a word aligned Data RAM address.

MAXCNT.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers in number of 32 bit words.

TASKS_STARTEPIN[%s].description: Description collection: Captures the EPIN[n].PTR and EPIN[n].MAXCNT registers values, and enables endpoint IN n to respond to traffic from host

TASKS_STARTISOIN.description: Captures the ISOIN.PTR and ISOIN.MAXCNT registers values, and enables sending data on ISO endpoint

TASKS_STARTEPOUT[%s].description: Description collection: Captures the EPOUT[n].PTR and EPOUT[n].MAXCNT registers values, and enables endpoint n to respond to traffic from host

TASKS_STARTISOOUT.description: Captures the ISOOUT.PTR and ISOOUT.MAXCNT registers values, and enables receiving of data on ISO endpoint

TASKS_EP0RCVOUT.description: Allows OUT data stage on control endpoint 0

TASKS_EP0STATUS.description: Allows status stage on control endpoint 0

TASKS_EP0STALL.description: Stalls data and status stage on control endpoint 0

TASKS_DPDMDRIVE.description: Forces D+ and D- lines into the state defined in the DPDMVALUE register

TASKS_DPDMNODRIVE.description: Stops forcing D+ and D- lines into any state (USB engine takes control)

EVENTS_USBRESET.description: Signals that a USB reset condition has been detected on USB lines

EVENTS_STARTED.description: Confirms that the EPIN[n].PTR and EPIN[n].MAXCNT, or EPOUT[n].PTR and EPOUT[n].MAXCNT registers have been captured on all endpoints reported in the EPSTATUS register

EVENTS_ENDEPIN[%s].description: Description collection: The whole EPIN[n] buffer has been consumed. The buffer can be accessed safely by software.

EVENTS_EP0DATADONE.description: An acknowledged data transfer has taken place on the control endpoint

EVENTS_ENDISOIN.description: The whole ISOIN buffer has been consumed. The buffer can be accessed safely by software.

EVENTS_ENDEPOUT[%s].description: Description collection: The whole EPOUT[n] buffer has been consumed. The buffer can be accessed safely by software.

EVENTS_ENDISOOUT.description: The whole ISOOUT buffer has been consumed. The buffer can be accessed safely by software.

EVENTS_SOF.description: Signals that a SOF (start of frame) condition has been detected on USB lines

EVENTS_USBEVENT.description: An event or an error not covered by specific events has occurred. Check EVENTCAUSE register to find the cause.

EVENTS_EP0SETUP.description: A valid SETUP token has been received (and acknowledged) on the control endpoint

EVENTS_EPDATA.description: A data transfer has occurred on a data endpoint, indicated by the EPDATASTATUS register

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

EVENTCAUSE.description: Details on what caused the USBEVENT event

EPIN[%s].description: Description collection: IN endpoint halted status. Can be used as is as response to a GetStatus() request to endpoint.

EPOUT[%s].description: Description collection: Number of bytes received last in the data stage of this OUT endpoint

EPSTATUS.description: Provides information on which endpoint's EasyDMA registers have been captured

EPDATASTATUS.description: Provides information on which endpoint(s) an acknowledged data transfer has occurred (EPDATA event)

WVALUEL.description: SETUP data, byte 2, LSB of wValue

WVALUEH.description: SETUP data, byte 3, MSB of wValue

WINDEXL.description: SETUP data, byte 4, LSB of wIndex

WINDEXH.description: SETUP data, byte 5, MSB of wIndex

WLENGTHL.description: SETUP data, byte 6, LSB of wLength

WLENGTHH.description: SETUP data, byte 7, MSB of wLength

ISOOUT.description: Number of bytes received last on this ISO OUT data endpoint

DPDMVALUE.description: State D+ and D- lines will be forced into by the DPDMDRIVE task. The DPDMNODRIVE task reverts the control of the lines to MAC IP (no forcing).

ISOSPLIT.description: Controls the split of ISO buffers

FRAMECNTR.description: Returns the current value of the start of frame counter

LOWPOWER.description: Controls USBD peripheral low power mode during USB suspend

ISOINCONFIG.description: Controls the response of the ISO IN endpoint to an IN token when no data is ready to be sent

MAXCNT.description: Maximum number of bytes to transfer

AMOUNT.description: Number of bytes transferred in the last transaction
